attributes.action: strip the title of 'Right Honourable' from all MPs.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Members of Parliament are elected by the citizens of the UK and therefore they are public servants. Why are we supposed to call them 'Right Honourable' when they are servants and may have done nothing exemplary to deserve that title?
During the existing expenses fiasco I would suggest that most of them are not at all honourable! Please remember that if the Freedom of Information Act hadn't been forced upon them they would have carried on claiming ludicrous expenses from the 'gravy train'!

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
